newsitem.title: USA: Bankers Trust profits rise 22 percent in first quarter.
newsitem.headline: Bankers Trust profits rise 22 percent in first quarter.

text.p: Bankers Trust New York Corp. said Thursday its first-quarter profits rose by 22 percent as revenues grew at a similar rate in all its businesses.

The New York-based bank, which announced this month it was merging with brokerage Alex. Brown Inc., said its net income for the three months ended March 31 rose to $169 million, or $1.89 a share, from $138 million, or $1.52 a share.
"Bankers Trust continued to make solid progress in the first quarter, driven by broad-based, diversified revenue gains in our core businesses worldwide," Chairman Frank Newman said in a statement.
The company said its total net revenues expanded by 23 to $1.18 billion from $958 million. It added that return on common equity rose to 14.3 percent from 11.9 percent.
Bankers Trust stock added 50 cents to $75.50 in late trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
